GLENFIDDICH UNBLENDED SINGLE-MALT 10 YR. WHISKY

What Is Malt Whisky? Sir Robert Bruce Lockhart refers to malt whisky as a ‘liquid gift which exalts the soul” and “goes down singing hymns.” For those who prefer less impassioned judgments, the original unblended Scotch Whisky, made only of malt, remaining untouched for many long years, has a distinction and superiority of its own. Some claim it is the local water that makes the difference. Others the local peat. Whatever it is. a single-malt, like a fine old cognac, has its own singular character.
